faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: Can I set up a bank account in the UAE without a residency visa?
items.answer: Absolutely, you can open a non-resident UAE bank account to preserve your wealth, hold assets, and conduct multi-currency transactions.

items.question: Can non-residents open a business bank account in Dubai?
items.answer: Yes! Once you provide the necessary documents, including corporate documents, shareholder information, trade license, proof of ownership, and source of funds, our experts can assist you in setting up your bank account.

items.question: How long does it take to set up a bank account in the UAE?
items.answer: Generally, it takes 1-21 business days to open a personal or business non-resident bank account.

items.question: Do I need an Emirates ID to create a UAE bank account?
items.answer: Yes, an Emirates ID is required to open a non-resident bank account in the UAE. However, some banks allow you to set up your savings account with just your passport and proof of address.

items.question: What happens to my UAE bank account if I go abroad?
items.answer: Your bank account will remain active so long as you continue to meet the bank’s requirements and update your information.
